alert.note: Alert for Carson; Gray (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Carson and northwestern Gray Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 730 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over White Deer, or 10 miles east of Panhandle, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pampa, White Deer and Kingsmill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.
